Speaker: meredith
Dialogue: Do do do do do do do do do do do!

Speaker: mysterious man
Dialogue: This way, my river lily.

Speaker: meredith
Dialogue: Where are you taking me?

Speaker: mysterious man
Dialogue: I was afraid it wouldn't take to the soil, but it rooted quickly.

Speaker: meredith
Dialogue: Which is what?

Speaker: mysterious man
Dialogue: Expansion.

Speaker: meredith
Dialogue: I'm not sure what you're talking about. But I like the way you say it.

Speaker: mysterious man
Dialogue: My heart is yours, Meredith Quill.

Speaker: meredith
Dialogue: I can't believe I fell in love with a spaceman.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Showtime, a-holes! It'll be here any minute!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Is that a rifle?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You don't know what a rifle is?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I thought your thing was a sword.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: We've been hired to stop an interdimensional beast from feeding on those batteries' energy, and I'm going to stop it with a sword?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Don't look at me like I'm stupid. You're the one being all inconsistent.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Drax, why aren't you wearing one of Rocket's aero-rigs?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: It hurts.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Hurts?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I have sensitive nipples.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: If I finish this, we can listen to tunes while we work.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: How is that a priority?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Blame Quill! He's the one who loves music so much!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I agree with Drax. It's hardly important right now.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Oh, sure, okayyyy, Quill.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: No, I really agree with him.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Sure, I know.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I can clearly see you winking.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Damn. I'm using my left eye? 5

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: They were not looking at you funny.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Groot, look - !

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Get out of the way, Groot! You're going to get hurt!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Spit it out! Spit it out!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: The beast's hide is too thick to be pierced from the outside. I must cut through it from the inside.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What is he doing?!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: He said the skin is too thick to be pierced from the outside, so he -- 8

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That doesn't make sense!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I tried to tell -- !

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Its skin is the same thickness from the inside as from the out!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I REALIZE THAT.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Gamora, there's a cut on its neck - Rocket, get it to look up.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Ha ha! I have single-handedly vanquished the beast! 9

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What are they called again?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Anulax batteries.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Harbulary batteries.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That's nothing like what I just said. But they're worth thousands of units a piece. Which is why the Sovereign hired us to protect them.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Sounds judgmental for a bunch of golden morons.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That's the kind of thing you might want to keep to yourself.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I'll hold my tongue, as long as they deliver what was promised.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Every citizen is born exactly as designed by the community, impeccable, both physically and mentally. We control the DNA of our progeny, germinating them in birthing pods.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I guess I prefer making people the old-fashioned way.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Well... perhaps someday you could give me a history lesson in the archaic ways of our ancestors... for academic purposes.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yeah, I mean, if it's for research that could be pretty --

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Oh, please.  Your people promised something in trade for our services. Bring it and we shall gladly be on our way.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Family reunion. Yaaaay.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: I understand she is your sister?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: She's worth no more to me than the bounty due for her on Xandar.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Our soldiers apprehended her attempting to steal the batteries. Do with her as you please.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Thank you, High Priestess Ayesha.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: What is your heritage, Mr. Quill?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: My mother is from earth.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: And your father?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: He's... not from Missouri, that's all I know.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: I see it within you, an unorthodox genealogy. A hybrid that seems particularly... reckless.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You know, they told me you people were conceited douchebags. But that isn't true at all.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Count yourself blessed they didn't kill you.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You're telling me. You wanna buy some batteries?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Let's get baldy back to Xandar and retrieve that bounty!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You all right?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That stuff about my father. Who does she think she is?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I know you're sensitive about that.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I'm not sensitive about it. I just don't know who he is.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I don't care if you were.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I think you do care. That's why I'm apologizing.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Gamora is not the one for you, Quill.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Uh huh.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I first met my beloved at a war rally.  14

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Well, that is pretty hot, but--

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: It would make my nether regions ENGORGE -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: All right, okay, fascinating, don't need to hear it. I get your point, I'm a dancer and Gamora is not.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: You just need to find a woman who is pathetic, like you.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: I am hungry. Hand me some of that yaro root.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: No. It's not ripe yet. And I hate you.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: You hate me?! You left me there while you stole that stone for yourself. Yet here you stand, a hero, a Garden of the Galaxy!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Why would we be `the Gardens of the Galaxy'?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: I don't know. I thought it was stupid.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Yeah, it would be.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: It's still wordy.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I wasn't the one who thought of it.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Your name doesn't matter. I'll be free of these shackles soon enough, and I'll kill you, I swear.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: No. You'll live out your days in a prison on Xandar, wishing you could.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: We got an armed Sovereign fleet, approaching from the rear.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Why would they do that?! 16

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Probably because Rocket stole some of their batteries.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Dude.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Oh, right. He didn't steal one of those. I don't know why they're after us. What a mystery this is.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What were you thinking?!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Dude, it was really easy to steal.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: That's your defense?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Come on. You saw how that high- priestess talked down to us! I'm teaching her a lesson!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Oh! I didn't realize your motivation was altruism. A shame the Sovereign have mistaken your intentions and are trying to kill us.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Exactly.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I WAS BEING SARCASTIC!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Oh no! You tricked me! You're supposed to use a sarcastic voice! Now I look foolish!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: SHUT UP, DRAX! You knew! You should have told us!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Did you tell him it was easy to steal?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Are you kidding me?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You never listen to anything!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: None of you listens! Can we please just put the bickering on hold until after we survive the massive space battle?!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Whoa. Somebody woke up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Do not try to bro down with me right now, dude. I will fricking punch you in your fricking face.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Real nice! Resorting to violence.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: More incoming!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: GOOD! I WANT TO KILL SOME GUYS!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You're not killing anyone. Those ships are all remotely piloted.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: What is the delay, Admiral?

Speaker: admiral
Dialogue: High Priestess, if we destroy their craft, we risk destroying the batteries. They're extraordinarily combustible and could, in turn, destroy the entire fleet.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: We have thousands of batteries and thousands of ships. Our concern is their slight against our people. We hired them and they steal from us? It is heresy of the highest order.

Speaker: admiral
Dialogue: All command modules -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What's the closest habitable planet?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: It's called Berhert.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: How many jumps?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Only one. But the access point is 47 clicks away. And it's through that Quantum Asteroid Field over there.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Quill, to make it through that, you'd have to be the greatest pilot in the universe.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Lucky for us -

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I am.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: What are you doing?!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I've been flying this rig since I was ten years old.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I was cybernetically engineered to pilot a spacecraft!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You were cybernetically engineered to be a douchebag.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Stop it!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Quill, later on tonight you're gonna lay down in your bed and there's gonna be something squishy in your pillowcase and you're gonna be, like, `what's this?' and it's gonna be because I put a turd in there.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You put your turd in my bed, I shave you.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Oh it won't be my turd, it will be Drax's.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I have famously huge turds.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: We're about to die, and this is what we're discussing?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: They raise havoc with the pipes. That's why I do all the plumbing. I take responsibility for my actions. Unlike some people...

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Groot, he's right, you have to start aiming inside the box.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Stop it.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Idiots!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Well, that's what you get when Quill flies.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: There's still a Sovereign craft behind us!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Our weapons are down!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Twenty clicks to the jump.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Where's he going?

Speaker: frightened pilot
Dialogue: Come on, Zylak, you can do this.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: It's not ripe.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Fifteen clicks.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Ten clicks.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Die, spaceship.

Speaker: frightened pilot
Dialogue: You suck, Zylak.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Five clicks!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Son-of-a-! They went around the field!

Speaker: admiral
Dialogue: Someone destroyed all the ships.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: What?! WHO?!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: What is that?!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Doesn't matter! That's the jump point! GO! GO!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: It's a guy.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Groot, put on your seat belt!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Prepare for a really bad -

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Either one    of you could have gotten us through    that field, if you had flown with    what's between your ears instead of    what's between your legs! 27

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: If what's between my legs had a hand on it, I guarantee I could have landed this ship.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: It's not funny, Peter. We almost died. Because of your arrogance.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: More like because he stoled Anulax batteries!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: They're called Harbulary batteries.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: No, they're not!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You know why I did it, Star-Munch?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I'm not going to answer to `Star- Munch.'

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I DID IT BECAUSE I WANTED TO.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Dick.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: What are we even talking about this for? We just had a little man save us by blowing up fifty ships!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: How little?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Like this.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: A little one-inch man saved us? 28

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Well, if he got closer I'm sure he'd be much larger.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That's how eyes work, you stupid raccoon.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Don't call me a raccoon!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, I meant to say `trash panda.'

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Is that better?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: It's worse.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: YOU SON-OF-A-!!

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Someone followed you through the jump point.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I'm not a fool, Nebula.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: You're a fool if you deprive yourself a hand in combat.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You'll attack me the moment I let you go. 29

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: No, I won't.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You'd think an evil supervillain would learn how to properly lie.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I bet it's the one-inch man!!

Speaker: mysterious man
Dialogue: After all these years, I've found you.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: mysterious man
Dialogue: I figured my rugged good looks would make that obvious. My name's Ego. And I'm your Dad, Peter.

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: And I was like, Aleta, I love you, but you're crazy now, you always BEEN -

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Stakar.

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: Seems like this establishment is the wrong kind of disreputable.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Stakar...

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: There are a hundred Ravager factions, Sneeper. You just lost the business of ninety-nine by serving one.

Speaker: proprietor
Dialogue: Please, sir! Sir!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You all can go to hell! I don't care what you think of me!

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: Then why you following us for?!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: `Cause you'll listen to what I got to say!

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: I don't got to listen to nothing! You betrayed the code! Ravagers don't deal in kids!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I didn't know what was going on -

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: You didn't know `cause you didn't want to know, `cause it made you rich!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I demand a seat at the table! I wear the flames same as you!

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: You may dress like a Ravager but you won't hear no Horns of Freedom when you die, boy, and the Colors of Ogord will not flash over your grave!  32

Speaker: monstrous ravager
Dialogue: First Quill betrays us and Yondu just lets him go, scot-free. Now he's getting all riled over nothing. We followed him `cause he was the one wasn't afraid to do what needed to be done. Seems like he's going soft.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: If he's so soft why you whispering for?

Speaker: monstrous ravager
Dialogue: You know I'm right, Kraglin.

Speaker: tullk
Dialogue: You best watch what you say about the Cap'n, Tay -

Speaker: retch
Dialogue: Who the hell is that?!

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Yondu Udonta, I have a proposition for you.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Because I was a skinny kid who could squeeze into places adults couldn't, making thieving easier.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I've been trying to track you down ever since.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I thought Yondu was your father.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: You look exactly alike.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: One's blue.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: He wasn't my father. Yondu was the guy who abducted me. He'd beat the crap out of me so I'd learn how to fight and he kept me in terror threatening to eat me.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Eat you?! 34

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: That son-of-a-bitch.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: How'd you locate us now?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Even where I reside, out past the edge of what's known, we've heard tell of the man they call Star- Lord.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Not buying it.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Peter, we need to take a walk.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I am Mantis.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What are you doing? 35

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Smiling. I hear it is the thing to do to make people like you.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Not if you do it like that.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Oh. I was raised alone on Ego's planet. I do not understand the intricacies of social interaction.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: AHH!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: That's called a practical joke!

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I liked it very much!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Give me a break! After all this time, and he just expects to be my Dad all of the sudden!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I hear you. 36

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I mean, this could be a trap - the Kree purists, the Ravagers, now the Sovereign - they all want us dead.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I know, but -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: But what?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: What was that story you told me about Zardu Hasselfrau?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: The wonderful television-singer man. He had a magic boat.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: David Hasselhoff?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: He had a talking car, not a magic -

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Why did it talk again?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Just to be a good friend, I guess.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: And as a child you carried his picture in your pocket, and you told the other children he was your father, but he was out of town --

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Shooting Knight Rider or touring with his band in Germany. Why are you bringing this up now? I was drunk when I told you that.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I love that story. 37

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I don't. It's just sad! I was so sad because I'd see the other kids off playing catch with their dads, and I wanted that, more than anything in the world.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: My point is, maybe this man is your Hasselhoff. I know it's a long shot. But I lost my father as a child. I'd give anything...

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: You're leaving me with that fox?!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: He's not a fox.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What about your spool of songs?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I have clones.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What if the Sovereign come?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: There's no way for them to know they're here.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I am uncertain about parting ways.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You're like an old woman.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Because I am wise?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Hope daddy isn't as big of a dick as you, orphan boy.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: So what's your goal here? To get everyone to hate you? `Cause it's working.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Can I ask you a personal question?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Oh, no one has ever asked me a personal question!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: The antennae, what are they for?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Their purpose?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Yes, Quill and I have a bet.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You're not supposed to say that. 40

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I say that if you are about to go through a doorway that is too low, your antennae will feel this, and stop you from being decapitated.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Just making clear - if it's anything else - any other answer - I win?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: They are not for feeling doorways.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Damn. I just lost my entire life's savings.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Three pairs of pants.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I think they have something to do with my empathic abilities.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: What are - ?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: If I touch someone I can feel their FEELINGS -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You read minds?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: No. Telepaths know thoughts. Empaths feel feelings. Emotions.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess, yeah, I have sort of a general, unselfish love for everyone.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: No, romantic, sexual love.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: No. No, I don't.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: For her.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: She just told everyone your deepest, darkest secret, Quill! HAHAHAHAHAHA!!!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What the hell, dude? That's a total overreaction.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: DO ME! DO ME!

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I have never felt such humor!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You got to be kidding me.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Touch me. And the only thing you're going to feel is a broken jaw.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I can also alter emotions, to some extent.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Like what?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: If I touch someone who is sad I can ease them into contentment, for a short while. I can make a stubborn person compliant. But I mostly use it to help my Master sleep. He lies awake at night, thinking about his progeny.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Do one of those on me!

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Sleep.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Is that real?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: It's kind of like someone put a baby's head on a big, muscular body, isn't it?

Speaker: tall ravager
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: brahl
Dialogue: Ain't so tough now without all your toys, are you?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Crap.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Hey there, rat.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: How's it going, you blue idiot?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Eh, not so bad. We got a pretty good gig. A golden gal with quite a high opinion of herself offered us a large sum to deliver you and your pals to her, so she can kill y'all.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Your friend. There's too many of them. They're going to kill him.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Pretty easy to find you, since we put a tracer on your ship back during the War over Xandar.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You give me your word you won't hurt Groot, and I'll tell you where the batteries are.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Lucky for you my word don't mean squat. Otherwise I'd actually hand you over.

Speaker: monstrous ravager
Dialogue: Otherwise you'd what?!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: We'll take the batteries. They're worth a a quarter mil on the open MARKET -

Speaker: monstrous ravager
Dialogue: That priestess offered us a million! A quarter is only one third of that!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: A quarter ain't one-th -

Speaker: oblo
Dialogue: A quarter is four times a million! We're in the money!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: NO -

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: The point is, we aren't stupid enough to help kill the Guardians of the Galaxy. We'd have the whole Nova Corps on us.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: That ain't right. I just gotta say it this one time, Cap'n.

Speaker: monstrous ravager
Dialogue: Damn straight, lad. You're right: he's going soft. S'pose it's time for a change in leadership!

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: UH -

Speaker: tullk
Dialogue: Put you damn guns down!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Hold on! There's got to be some sort of peaceful resolution here! Or even a violent resolution, where I'm standing over there.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Well, hello, boys.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Welcome, friends, to my world.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Wow. You have your own planet? 49

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: But a trifle, no larger than your earth's moon.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Humility. I like it. I too, am extraordinarily humble.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: It's beautiful.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Peter, consider this a token of a father's pride.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Single-handedly?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Whoa. It's perfect.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You've got to be kidding.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Why am I dead? Why did you all kill me?!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: That's Ronan. That's you. 50

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: When was I that tiny?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You own a planet and can destroy two dozen spaceships without a suit. What are you, exactly?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I'm what they call a Celestial, sweetheart.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: A Celestial. Like a... god?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Small `g', son. At least on the days I'm feeling humble as Drax.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: This form you see before you is only an extension of who I truly am. I don't know where I came from, exactly.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: But I was no ant to be fulfilled solely by labor. I wanted more. I desired... meaning.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Did you make a penis?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Dude. 52

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: If he's a planet, how did he make a baby with your mother? He would smush her.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I don't need to hear about how my parents, you know -

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Why? My father would tell me the story of impregnating my mother every winter solstice.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That's disgusting.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: It was beautiful. You earthers have hang-ups.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Yes, Drax, I've got a penis.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: It's not half bad. I've also got pain receptors, a digestive system, and all the accompanying junk. I wanted to experience what it truly meant to be human as I set out amongst the stars.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: When did you meet my mother? 53

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Not long after.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: If you loved her why did you leave her?

Speaker: tullk
Dialogue: This is mutiny! Mutiny!

Speaker: oblo
Dialogue: Cap'n, help me! Cap'n?!

Speaker: monstrous ravager
Dialogue: You're the one what kilt those men by leading `em down the wrong path.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Your name is... it's `Taserface'?

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Do you... shoot tasers out of your face?

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: It's metaphorical!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: It's a name what strikes fear in anyone what hears it!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Really?... Okay, sure.

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: You shut up! You're next!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. I just keep imagining you waking up one morning, looking in the mirror, and, in all seriousness, saying `You know what would be a really kickass name? Taserface!' 56

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: New plan. We're killing you first.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Well, dying is certainly better than having to live an entire life as a moronic shitbag who thinks `Taserface' is a cool name.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: That's enough killing for today.

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: Thought you were the biggest sadist in the galaxy.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: That was when Daddy was paying my bills. The Priestess wants to kill the fox herself. And he -  - has bounties on his head in at least twelve Kree provinces.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: We got a whole box of hands if that one don't work out.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: It's fine.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: You think them Kree is gonna execute the Cap'n?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: The Kree consider themselves merciful. It will be painless.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Well, there it is, best ship we got. The location of Ego's planet's in the nav. We'll wire you the ten percent when we's paid. What you gonna do with your share?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: As a child my father would have Gamora and me battle one another in `training.' Every time my sister prevailed my father would replace a piece of me with machinery, claiming he wanted me to be her equal. But she won, again and again and again. Never once refraining. Because of them, I am this. So after I murder my sister, I will buy a warship with every conceivable instrument of death.  58

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Yeah... I was talking about, like, a pretty necklace. Or a nice hat. Something that'll make the other girls go `oooooo, that's nice.'

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: My mother told everyone my father was from the stars.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: PETER -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Listen. I'd love to believe all of this, I really would - but you left the most wonderful woman ever, to die alone!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I didn't want to leave your mother, Peter. But if I don't return regularly to this planet, and the light within, this form will wither and perish -- 59

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: So why didn't you come back?! Why'd you send Yondu, a criminal, of all people, to fetch me?!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I loved your mother, Peter! I couldn't stand to set foot on an earth where she wasn't living! You can't imagine what that's like!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I know exactly what that's like! I had to watch her die!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Over the millions and millions of years of my existence I have made many mistakes, Peter. But you're not one of them. Please give me the chance to be the father she would want me to be.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Give me your hands, son.    Here. Hold them like that.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Whoa.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Yes, yes - it's okay. Just relax. Concentrate. You can do it. Bring it back.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: How did you get here?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Ego found me in my larva state, orphaned on my homeworld. He raised me by hand, and kept me as his own.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: So you're a pet?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I suppose.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: People usually want cute pets. Why would Ego want a hideous one?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I am hideous?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: You're horrifying to look at, yes.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Oh?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: When you are ugly and someone loves you, you know they love you for who you are. Beautiful people never know who to trust.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Well, then I am certainly grateful to be ugly!  Poor Gamora. She can never trust anyone.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Those pools remind me of a time I took my daughter to visit the Forgotten Lakes on my homeworld. She was like you.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Disgusting?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Innocent.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I have never met anyone like you, or your friends. You are filled with such... love. It is a thing I did not know existed, not like this, and I think... I think it may be the very finest of all things. It both hurts and soothes the heart.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I am learning many things. Like I am a pet and ugly.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You're not ugly.  Drax.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Why are there no other beings on this planet?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: The planet IS Ego. A dog would not invite a flea to live on his back.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: And you're not a flea?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I'm a flea with a purpose. I help him sleep.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: What were you about to say to Drax before I walked out?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: We'll deliver you to the Kree in the morning. Neither one of you gonna last much longer after that.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Okay, Taserface. See you later, Taserface. Hey, Taserface, tell the other guys we said hi, Taserface!

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: No, Gef! It's too adorable to kill. Bring it to the tailor.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: No offense, but your employees are a bunch of jerks.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I was a Kree battle-slave for twenty years when Stakar freed me. He offered me a place in the Ravagers. Said all I needed to do was adhere to the code. But I was young and greedy and stupid - like you stealing those batteries.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: That was mostly Drax.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Me and Stakar, and the other captains - we weren't so different from you and your friends. The only family I ever had. But I broke the code. They exiled me. 65

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Slow down, drama queen. You might deserve this, but I don't. We gotta get out of here.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Where's Quill?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Went off with his old man.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Ego?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Yeah. It's a day for dumbass names.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You're like a professional asshole or - ?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Pretty much a pro. Why didn't you deliver Quill to Ego like you promised?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: He was skinny, could fit into places we couldn't. Good for thieving.

Speaker: retch
Dialogue: Lil' feller's all worked up! Needs a drank!

Speaker: half-nut
Dialogue: It's Goddang precious!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Oh, man. What'd they do to you?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Hey, you wanna help us get outta here?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: That's my underwears.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Yeah, I was pretty sure he didn't know what you were talking about. You have to explain it more careful.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: All right. It's a prototype fin -

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: That's an orloni. It's a fin, Groot.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You explain it this time.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: That's Vorker's eye. He takes it out when he sleeps. Go look again.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: But leave the eye here.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He's gonna wake up tomorrow and he's not gonna know where his eye is!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: That's a desk. We told you it was this big.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Tell me you guys have a refrigerator somewhere with a bunch of severed human toes.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: The drawer you want to open. Has this symbol on it, okay?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He thinks you want him to wear it as a hat.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: That's not what I said.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He's relieved that you don't want him to.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He hates hats.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: On anyone, not just himself.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: One minute you think someone has a weird-shaped head. The next minute, it's just because you realize part of that head is a hat.  That's why you don't like hats?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: This is an important conversation right now?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: No.   Let's try again.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: I didn't mean to do a mutiny.  They killed all my friends. 71

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Go get the third quadrant ready for release.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: One more thing.

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: He's got it!

Speaker: retch
Dialogue: GO!

Speaker: scurrilous ravager
Dialogue: Down there!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You maniac. The whole ship is gonna blow.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Not the whole ship.

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: I'm sending you the coordinates for Yondu's ship. 76

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Release the quadrant.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: AYE CAPN'

Speaker: taserface
Dialogue: I only ask one thing. That your High Priestess tells him the name of the man what sealed his fate: Taserface.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Where to, Cap'n?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Ego.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: NO, BOY!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: It ain't healthy for a mammalian body to hop over fifty jumps at a time.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I know that.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: We're about to do seven-hundred.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: So I guess this could all be mine someday. 78

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Rocket? Rocket, you there?   Dammit.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Dance with me.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: No. I'm not --

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Come on. This is Sam Cooke, one of the greatest Earth singers of all time.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: If you ever tell anyone about this, I'll kill you.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: When are we going to do something about this... unspoken thing between us?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: What unspoken thing?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: THIS CHEERS-SAM-AND-DIANE-GUY-AND- GIRL-ON-A-TV-SHOW-WHO-DIG-EACH- OTHER-BUT-NEVER-SAY-IT-'CAUSE-WHEN- THEY-DO-THE-RATINGS-WOULD-GO-DOWN sort of thing? 79

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: There is no unspoken thing between us.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Well, that's a Catch-22. Because if you said there was, it would be spoken, and then you'd be a liar. So by saying there isn't, you're telling the truth, and admitting there is.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: That's not --

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What are you talking about? You were the one who wanted me to come here!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: That girl, Mantis. She's afraid of something.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Why are you trying to take this from me?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I'm not --

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: He's my father. He's blood -

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You have blood on earth. You never wanted to return there. 80

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Again - you made me come here! And Earth?! Earth is the place my mother died in front of me.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: No, it's because that's real, and this is a fantasy.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: This is real. I'm only half human, remember?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: That's the half I'm worried about.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Oh, I get it. You're jealous because I'm part god! You like me being the weak one!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Uh. You were insufferable to begin with. I haven't been able to reach Rocket. I'm going to see if I can get a signal outside.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You know, this isn't Cheers after all. It's whatever the show is where one person is willing to, you know, open themselves up to new possibilities, and the other person is just kind of a jerk who doesn't trust anyone! It's a show that doesn't exist - it would never be made, it would be so horrible! It would get zero ratings!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You're having a conversation with yourself! I don't know what Cheers is!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I finally found my family, don't you understand that!?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I thought you already had. 81

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: So this is how it ends, then? Our whole story. Like this? You and me?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Get it through your head, Peter. There is no you and me. There never was.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Dammit.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You psychopath.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Are you kidding me?!

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: I win.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Uh, no, I just spared your life -

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: You were stupid enough to let me live so -

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You just let me live!

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: I WIN! 84

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I'm not the one who just flew across the universe because I wanted to win!

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Don't tell me what I want!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I don't have to because you make it OBVI -

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: YOU WERE THE ONE WHO WANTED TO WIN, I JUST WANTED A SISTER!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: It's fortuitous you're listening to this song.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You know - ?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: `Brandy' by Looking Glass.   A favorite of your mom's.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: One of earth's greatest musical compositions. Perhaps its very greatest.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yeah, it is.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: You and I, Peter, we're the sailor in the song.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Well, you might not be mortal, but ME -

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Death will remain a stranger to both of us as long as the light burns within the planet.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I'm immortal? That's... really?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Yes, as long as the light exists.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: And I can use the light to make cool things? Like how you made all this?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: It'll take thousands of years of practice before you get really good at it . But, yes.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Well, get ready for an eight hundred foot statue of Pac Man, then. With Skeletor. And Heather Locklear. I'm gonna make some weird shit.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I can't wait to see your weird shit.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Wow, that...

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Came out a little disgusting.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Come with me.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Ugh. I am sorry, but I like a woman with some meat on her bones.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I tried to let you down easily by telling you I found you disgusting.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: No! That's not what I -

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I'm imagining being with you physically! 88

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Drax, that's not - I don't like you like that. I don't even like the type of thing you are.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Hey! There's no need to get personal!

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Listen! Ego's gotten exactly what he wanted. I should have told you earlier, I am stupid. You are in danger.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: You need to readjust the way you process life. Everything around us - including the girl - is temporary. We are forever.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Doesn't eternity get boring?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Not if you have a purpose, Peter. Which is why you're here. I told you how all those years ago I had an unceasing impulse to find life.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: And that is when I came to a profound realization.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: My innate desire to seek out other life was not so that I could walk among that life.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I see it. Eternity.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: We need to get off this planet.

Speaker: stan lee
Dialogue: Anyway, before I was so rudely interrupted, that time I was a World War II vet -

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: What the hell you doing, boy?!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I could tell by how you talked about him - this Ego is bad news. We're here to save Quill.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: For what?  For `honor'? For `love'?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: No! I don't care about those things! I want to save Quill so I can prove I'm better than him! I can lord this over him forever!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You can fool yourself and everyone else but you can't fool me. I know who you are.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You don't know anything about me, loser. 91

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I know everything about you. I know you play like the meanest and the hardest `cause you actually the most scared of all.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I know you steal batteries you don't need and you push away anyone who's willing to put up with you, `cause just a little bit of love reminds you how big and empty that hole inside you actually is!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I said, shut up.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I know the scientists what made you never gave a rat's ass about you -

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I'm serious, dude - !

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Just   like my own damn parents, who sold   me, their own little baby, into   slavery! I know who you are, boy,   because you're me.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: What kind of pair are we?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: The kind that's about to go fight a planet I reckon.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: All right, okay, that's - Wait. Fight a what?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Who are you people?! What is this place?!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What is she doing here?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Just watching the fireworks.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Gamora, let her go!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: The bodies in the caverns, who are they?!

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: You are scared.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I call it the Expansion. It is my purpose. And now it's yours as well.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: It's beautiful.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Over thousands of years I implanted thousands of extensions of myself on thousands of worlds. 93

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: What did she do to me?!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: She already told me everything.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I only had one problem. A single Celestial doesn't have enough power for such an enterprise. But two Celestials - well now, that just might do.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: The bodies are his children.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Out of all my labors the most beguiling was attempting to graft my DNA with that of another species. I hoped the result of such a coupling would be enough to power the expansion.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: That was true. They never felt a thing. But, one after the other, they failed me. None of them had the Celestial genes. Until you, Peter. Out of all my spawn, only you have carried the connection to the light.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: We need to find Peter now and get off this damn planet.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: Ego will have won him to his side by now. He has a way of -

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Then we just go.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: No. He's our friend.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: All any of you do is yell at each other. You're not friends.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: You're right. We're family. We leave no one behind.  Except maybe you.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Oh my god.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: For the first time in my life, I am truly not alone. 95

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: My friends.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: That's the mortal in you, Peter.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yes. I don't need that.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: What are we?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Forever.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: What are they?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Temporary.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: You think you love them. But love is merely an evolutionary trick in the service of reproduction. We are beyond such things.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: NOW -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: But my mother.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: That I did. My river lily, who knew the words to every song that came on the radio. I returned to earth to see her three times. I knew if I came back a fourth, I'd never leave.  96

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Wh- what?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I know that sounds bad -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You killed my mother!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I tried so hard to find the form that best suited you, and this is the thanks I get?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Rocket?!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Keep that transmitter nearby so I can find you. We're in an old piece of construction equipment Yondu once used to slice open the Bank of A'askavaria.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I know. Get ready.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Drop it, Kraglin!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I got a plan.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: What is it? 98

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: It's pretty simple.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: NO.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: `My life, my love, my lady is the sea'? Peter, THIS IS THE SEA.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Hey there, Jackass.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Out of the way, dumber, smaller Groot.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I told you something didn't feel right.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: `I told you so.' That's really what I need right now.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I came back, didn't I?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Because there's an unspoken thing.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: There is no unspoken thing.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What are you doing? You could have killed us all crashing in here like that!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Uh, `Thank you, Rocket'?

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: We had it under control.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: We did not. That is only an extension of his true self. He will be back soon.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What's Smurfette doing here!?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Back rubs, dishes, killing gods, whatever I need to do to get a damn ride home.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: She tried to murder me!

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: I saved you, you stupid fox.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: He's not a fox. 101

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I'm not a raboon either!

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: `Raccoon,' whatever!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: How do we kill a Celestial?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: There's the center to him - his brain, his soul, whatever it is, in some sort of shell --

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: It's in the caverns below the surface.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: YONDU?

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: If he's got that fin back, I am so screwed.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Thrusters are out!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I guess I should be glad I was a skinny kid. Otherwise you would have delivered me to this maniac!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You still reckon that's the reason I kept you around, you idiot?!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: That's what you told me, you old doofus!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Once I figured out what happened to them other kids, I wasn't gonna just hand you over.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You said you were gonna eat me!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: That was being funny!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Not to me!!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: You people have issues.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Of course I have issues that's my fricking father!!... Thrusters are back up.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: We should be going up!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: We can't. Ego wants to eradicate the universe as we know it. We have to kill him.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Got it.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I guess.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Awesome. We'll really be able to jack up our prices if we're two- time-galaxy savers.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I seriously can't believe that is where your mind goes.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: It was just a random thought, man! I thought we were friends!  104

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: And the people.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Meh.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: The crabby puppy is so cute he makes me want to die!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Your suicidal thoughts sadden me, but your wish will likely come true.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Pilots, release envoy units!

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Our sensors detect the batteries are below the surface of the planet. 105

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: Dive!

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Uhh... Cap'n?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: So why'd Ego want you here?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: He needs my genetic connection to the light to help destroy the universe. He tried to teach me how to control the power.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: So could you?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: A little. I made a ball.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: A ball?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I thought as hard as a could, that's all I could come up with.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You `thought'?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What do you use?

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Whoa.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: There! Thats Ego's core.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: That ore's thick. Rocket, we're gonna need to use the big laser.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: We must hurry. It will not take Ego long to find us.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Keep it still! 107

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: We drill into the center, we kill him.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: What is it, Kraglin?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Yeah, why?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Why aren't you firing the laser?!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: They blew out the generator! I think I packed a small detonator.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: A detonator is worthless without explosives!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: We got these!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Is it strong enough to kill Ego?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: If it is, it will cause a chain reaction throughout his entire nervous system.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Meaning what?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: The entire planet will explode. We'll have to get out of here fast. I rigged a timer.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: He's coming.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Didn't you say you could make him sleep?

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: When he wants! He's too powerful! I can't!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: You don't have to believe in yourself because I believe in you.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: SLEEP!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: I never thought she'd be able to do it. With as skinny and weak as she appears to be.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: I don't know how long I can hold him! 110

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: You need to, girl. If you don't keep Ego at bay, we all die.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: The metal is too thick! For the bomb to work we'd actually need to place it on Ego's core. And our fat butts ain't gonna fit through those tiny holes.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Well...

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: That's a terrible idea.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Which is the only kind of idea we got left.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Unbelievable. `Rocket, do this. Rocket, do that.'

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Uh, what a day.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: All right. First you flick this switch, then this switch. That activates it. And then you push this button, which will give you five minutes to get out of there. Whatever you do don't push this button, because that will set off the bomb immediately, and we'll all be dead. Now repeat back what I just said.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Uh huh.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: No! That's the button that will kill everyone! Try again.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: No! That's exactly what you just said! How is that even possible?! Which button is the button you're supposed to push?! Point to it.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Shut up! And give me some tape! Does anyone have any tape out there!? I want to put some tape over the death button!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I don't have any tape.    Let me check.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Not a single person has tape? 113

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You have priceless batteries and an atomic bomb in your bag! If anyone had tape it would be you!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: That's exactly my point! I have to do everything!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Dude, you're wasting time!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: We're all gonna die.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: We're done for without the generator.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: They will serve as a warning to all of those tempted with betraying us; don't screw with the Sovereign.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: This is gonna hurt.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Promises, promises.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: NO! NOOOOO!! 115

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: We're gonna blow!

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Peter?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You look like Mary Poppins.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Is he cool?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yeah. He's cool.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I'm Mary Poppins, y'all!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Oh. Wow.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: She's just unconscious.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: How long before the bomb goes off?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: In the unlikely event Groot doesn't kill us all, about six minutes.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Kraglin.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Aye, Cap'n!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Someone needs to be up top when Kraglin arrives. Drax, take Mantis.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Ahhh! My nipples!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Gamora!!

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: Oh, get over it. 118

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: We have to get up to the extraction point!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: I told you I don't want to do this alone.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: You cannot deny the purpose the universe has bestowed upon you!

Speaker: officer fitzgibbon
Dialogue: Please, everyone. Step back. I need you all to clear the -

Speaker: grandpa quill
Dialogue: Come on, ma'am.

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: It doesn't need to be like this PETER

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Why are you destroying our chance?!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Stop pretending you aren't, what you are!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: One in billions..

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: Trillions, even more! 122

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: What greater meaning could life possibly have to offer?!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I don't use my head to fly the arrow, boy! I use my h -

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: You shouldn't have killed my mom and squished my walkman.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Groot! Groot, if you can can hear me, hurry up - I'm not sure how long Quill can keep him distracted!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Yondu! We're about to blow!

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Get to the ship.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Not without Quill.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: You gotta take care of the twig.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Not without you.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I ain't done nothing right my whole damn life, rat. You need to give me this.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: A space suit and an aero rig. I only have one of each.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He says welcome to the frickin' Guardians of the Galaxy... only he didn't use `frickin'.

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: Bye, twig.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: We're gonna need to have a discussion about your language.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Where's Peter?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I can only afford to lose one friend today.  Kraglin, GO!

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: Wait. Is Quill back?  Rocket, where's Quill?!

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: No, we need to stop it!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What's so wrong with that?

Speaker: ego
Dialogue: NO -

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: He may have been your father, boy. But he wasn't your daddy.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: yondu
Dialogue: I'm sorry I didn't do it right. I'm damn lucky you're my boy.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Yondu, you can't! What are you doing? What are you doing?!

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: The other day I told Gamora how I used to pretend my dad was David Hasselhoff.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Yeah. That's the friend I was talking about.

Speaker: groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He did call you `twig.'

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: Nebula.

Speaker: nebula
Dialogue: I'll help them by killing Thanos.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: I don't know if that's possible.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Pete.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Wait.

Speaker: kraglin
Dialogue: Thank you... Cap'n.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: They came.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: I sent word to Yondu's old Ravager buddies and told them what he did.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: It's a Ravager funeral.

Speaker: martinex
Dialogue: He didn't let us down after all, Cap'n.

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: No, he did not, son. He did not. 135

Speaker: charlie-27
Dialogue: Fare thee well, old friend.

Speaker: aleta
Dialogue: See you in the stars, Yondu Udonta.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: He didn't chase `em away.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: Even though he yelled at `em.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Of course not.

Speaker: gamora
Dialogue: It's just some unspoken thing.

Speaker: mantis
Dialogue: It's beautiful.

Speaker: drax
Dialogue: It is. And so are you.  On the inside.

Speaker: stakar
Dialogue: It's a shame it takes a tragedy like losing Yondu to bring us all back together. But I think he'd be proud if he knew we were working as a team again.

Speaker: charlie-27
Dialogue: In.

Speaker: martinex
Dialogue: Dope.

Speaker: mainframe
Dialogue: I MISSED you guys!

Speaker: aleta
Dialogue: Hell. Yes.

Speaker: chambermaid
Dialogue: High Priestess, the Council is waiting.

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: They are perturbed I have wasted our resources.

Speaker: chambermaid
Dialogue: That is not just another birthing pod, ma'am?

Speaker: ayesha
Dialogue: That, my child, is the next step in our evolution: more powerful, more beautiful, and more capable of destroying the Guardians of the Galaxy.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: Dude, seriously, you got to clean up your room. It's a complete mess.

Speaker: adolescent groot
Dialogue: I am Groot.

Speaker: quill
Dialogue: I'm not boring, man. You're boring. Once I got stuck on a planet where everyone was just lines and dots. I had to use geometry to get out of prison. Is that boring?
